financial_aid_options.name: MOE Tuition Grant Scheme (TGS)
financial_aid_options.description: Government subsidy for Singapore Citizens and PRs studying at autonomous universities (NUS, NTU, SMU, SUTD, SIT, SUSS). Significantly reduces tuition fees.

eligibility.requirements: Automatic for citizens. PRs must serve 3-year bond after graduation.

typical_savings.citizen_degree: S$24,000 per year (annual tuition reduced from S$32,000 to S$8,200)

financial_aid_options.application_process: Automatic application when accepting university offer. No separate application needed.
financial_aid_options.bond_requirement: PRs and international students must work in Singapore for 3 years after graduation
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Core government initiative to make education affordable for citizens. Reduces financial burden significantly.

financial_aid_options.name: MOE Bursary
financial_aid_options.description: Need-based bursary for Singapore Citizens from lower-income families. Amount varies based on household income.

eligibility.requirements: Per Capita Income (PCI) ≤ S$3,100 or Gross Household Income (GHI) ≤ S$9,000

financial_aid_options.application_process: Apply through university financial aid office. Submit income documents (payslips, tax statements).
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Government's commitment to ensure no student is denied education due to financial difficulties

financial_aid_options.name: University-Specific Bursaries
financial_aid_options.description: Additional bursaries offered by individual universities (NUS, NTU, SMU) for students facing financial need. Can be combined with MOE Bursary.

eligibility.requirements: Demonstrate financial need. Each university has specific criteria.

examples.nus: NUS Bursary, NUS Grant: S$1,500-S$5,000/year based on household income
examples.ntu: NTU Study Grant, NTU Bursary: S$2,000-S$4,000/year
examples.smu: SMU Bursary: S$2,000-S$6,000/year for needy students

financial_aid_options.application_process: Apply through respective university financial aid portals. Requires income documentation and personal statement.
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Universities supplement government support to ensure accessibility for all qualified students

financial_aid_options.name: SkillsFuture Credit
financial_aid_options.description: Government credit for Singaporeans aged 25+ to upskill. Can be used for approved courses, certifications, and training programs.

eligibility.requirements: Must be 25 years or older. Credit does not expire.

financial_aid_options.what_it_covers: Short courses, certifications (AWS, Coursera, Udemy approved courses), diploma programs, continuing education
financial_aid_options.application_process: Check SkillsFuture Credit balance at MySkillsFuture portal. Use during course enrollment.
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Part of Singapore's lifelong learning initiative. Encourages continuous skills upgrading in fast-changing economy.

financial_aid_options.name: CPF Education Loan Scheme
financial_aid_options.amount: Use CPF Ordinary Account savings for tuition
financial_aid_options.description: Singapore Citizens and PRs can use their CPF Ordinary Account savings to pay for tuition fees at approved institutions.

eligibility.requirements: Have sufficient balance in CPF Ordinary Account. For approved institutions only.

financial_aid_options.how_it_works: Withdraw from your CPF OA to pay fees. Must repay principal + interest (2.5% p.a.) after graduation. Can also use parents'/spouse's CPF.
financial_aid_options.application_process: Apply through CPF Board when paying tuition fees.
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Leverages Singapore's CPF system to provide low-interest education financing for citizens and PRs

financial_aid_options.name: MENDAKI Tertiary Tuition Fee Subsidy (TTFS)
financial_aid_options.description: Financial assistance for Malay/Muslim students from lower-income families pursuing tertiary education.

eligibility.requirements: Malay/Muslim students. Household income ≤ S$3,000 or PCI ≤ S$750.

financial_aid_options.application_process: Apply through MENDAKI website with income documents and academic transcripts.
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Community-based support for Malay/Muslim community's educational advancement

financial_aid_options.name: CDAC Bursary
financial_aid_options.description: Financial assistance for Chinese students from lower-income families.

eligibility.requirements: Chinese students. Household income ≤ S$3,000 or PCI ≤ S$750.

financial_aid_options.application_process: Apply through CDAC with supporting documents
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Community organization supporting Chinese students' educational needs

financial_aid_options.name: SINDA University Assistance
financial_aid_options.description: Financial aid for Indian students from lower-income families.
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Supports Indian community members' pursuit of higher education

financial_aid_options.name: Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA) Loan
financial_aid_options.description: Government education loan for Singaporeans with favorable terms. Lower interest than commercial banks.

eligibility.requirements: Pursuing approved tertiary programs in Singapore

financial_aid_options.repayment: Starts after graduation. Up to 20 years repayment period.
financial_aid_options.application_process: Apply through university or CPF Board
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Government provides accessible credit for education with favorable terms compared to commercial loans

financial_aid_options.name: University Merit Scholarships
financial_aid_options.description: Merit-based scholarships awarded by NUS, NTU, SMU for outstanding students. Covers tuition and provides living allowance.

eligibility.requirements: Excellent academic record (typically straight A's), strong CCA, leadership. Interview required.

examples.nus_scholarship: NUS Global Merit Scholarship: Full tuition + S$6,000/year
examples.ntu_scholarship: NTU University Scholars Programme: Full tuition + S$6,500/year + overseas exposure
examples.smu_scholarship: SMU Scholarship: Full tuition + S$5,000/year allowance

financial_aid_options.application_process: Apply during university application. Separate scholarship application required. Interview for shortlisted candidates.
financial_aid_options.bond_requirement: Typically 3-6 year bond to work in Singapore
financial_aid_options.singapore_context: Universities attract top talent with comprehensive financial support. Bondable scholarships ensure talent retention in Singapore.
